verses.verse: And the famine <WH7458> was severe <WH3515> in the land <WH776>.

And it came to pass <WH3615>, when they had eaten up the corn <WH7668> which they had brought out <WH935> of Egypt <WH4714>, their father <WH1> said <WH559> unto them <WH7725>, Go again, buy <WH7666> us a little <WH4592> food <WH400>.

And Judah <WH3063> spoke <WH559> unto him <WH559>, saying, The man <WH376> did solemnly <WH5749> protest <WH5749> unto us <WH559>, saying, you shall not see <WH7200> my face <WH6440>, except <WH1115> your brother be with you <WH251>.
If you will <WH3426> send <WH7971> our brother <WH251> with us <WH3381>, we will go down and buy <WH7666> you food <WH400>:
But if you will not send <WH7971> him <WH3381>, we will not go down: for the man <WH376> said <WH559> unto us <WH7200>, you shall not see my face <WH6440>, except your brother be with you <WH251>.
And Israel <WH3478> said <WH559>, Wherefore dealt you so ill <WH7489> with me <WH5046>, as to tell the man <WH376> whether you had yet a brother <WH251>?

And they said <WH559>, The man <WH376> asked <WH7592> us directly <WH7592> of our state <WH4138>, and of our relatives, saying <WH559>, Is your father <WH1> yet alive <WH2416>? have you <WH3426> another brother <WH251>? and we told <WH5046> him according <WH5921> to the tone <WH6310> of these words <WH1697>: could we certainly <WH3045> know <WH3045> that he would say <WH559>, Bring <WH3381> your brother <WH251> down <WH3381>?

And Judah <WH3063> said <WH559> unto Israel <WH3478> his father <WH1>, Send <WH7971> the lad <WH5288> with me <WH6965>, and we will arise and go <WH3212>; that we may live <WH2421>, and not die <WH4191>, both we <WH2945>, and you and also our little ones.

I will be collateral <WH6148> for him <WH3027>; of my hand shall you require <WH1245> him <WH518>: if I bring <WH935> him not <WH518> unto you and set <WH3322> him before you <WH6440>, then let me bear the blame <WH2398> for ever <WH3117>:
For except <WH3884> we had lingered <WH4102>, surely now we had returned <WH7725> this second time <WH6471>.

And their father <WH1> Israel <WH3478> said <WH559> unto them <WH645>, If it must be so now, do <WH6213> this <WH3947>; take of the best fruits <WH2173> in the land <WH776> in your vessels <WH3627>, and carry down <WH3381> the man <WH376> a present <WH4503>, a little <WH4592> balm <WH6875>, and a little <WH4592> honey <WH1706>, spices <WH5219>, and myrrh <WH3910>, nuts <WH992>, and almonds <WH8247>:

And take <WH3947> double <WH4932> money <WH3701> in your hand <WH3027>; and the money <WH3701> that was brought again <WH7725> in the mouth <WH6310> of your sacks <WH572>, carry it again <WH7725> in your hand <WH3027>; maybe it was an oversight <WH4870>:
Take <WH3947> also your brother <WH251>, and arise <WH6965>, go again <WH7725> unto the man <WH376>:

And God <WH410> Almighty <WH7706> give <WH5414> you mercy <WH7356> before <WH6440> the man <WH376>, that he may send away <WH7971> your other <WH312> brother <WH251>, and Benjamin <WH1144>. If <WH834> I be bereaved <WH7921> of my sons I am bereaved <WH7921>.

And the men <WH582> took <WH3947> that <WH2063> present <WH4503>, and they took <WH3947> double <WH4932> money <WH3701> in their hand <WH3027>, and Benjamin <WH1144>; and rose up <WH6965>, and went down <WH3381> to Egypt <WH4714>, and stood <WH5975> before <WH6440> Joseph <WH3130>.

And when Joseph <WH3130> saw <WH7200> Benjamin <WH1144> with <WH854> them <WH559>, he said to the ruler of his house <WH1004>, Bring <WH935> these men <WH582> home <WH1004>, and kill <WH2873>, and make ready <WH3559>; for these men <WH582> shall dine <WH398> with me at noon <WH6672>.
And the man <WH376> did <WH6213> as Joseph <WH3130> ordered <WH559>; and the man <WH376> brought <WH935> the men <WH582> into Joseph <WH3130>'s house <WH1004>.

And the men <WH582> were afraid <WH3372>, because they were brought <WH935> into Joseph <WH3130>'s house <WH1004>; and they said <WH559>, Because <WH1697> of the money <WH3701> that was returned <WH7725> in our sacks <WH572> at the first time <WH8462> are we brought in <WH935>; that he may seek occasion <WH1556> against us <WH5307>, and fall upon us <WH3947>, and take us for bondmen <WH5650>, and our donkeys <WH2543>.
And they came near <WH5066> to the steward <WH376> of Joseph <WH3130>'s house <WH1004>, and they talked <WH1696> with him at the door <WH6607> of the house <WH1004>,
And said <WH559>, O <WH994> sir <WH113>, we came indeed <WH3381> down <WH3381> at the first time <WH8462> to buy <WH7666> food <WH400>:

And it came to pass <WH935>, when we came to the inn <WH4411>, that we opened <WH6605> our sacks <WH572>, and <WH376>, behold, every man's money <WH3701> was in the mouth <WH6310> of his sack <WH572>, our money <WH3701> in full weight <WH4948>: and we have brought it again <WH7725> in our hand <WH3027>.
And other <WH312> money <WH3701> have we brought down <WH3381> in our hands <WH3027> to buy <WH7666> food <WH400>: we cannot tell <WH3045> who put <WH7760> our money <WH3701> in our sacks <WH572>.

And he said <WH559>, Peace <WH7965> be to you <WH3372>, fear not <WH430>: your God, and the God <WH430> of your father <WH1>, has given <WH5414> you treasure <WH4301> in your sacks <WH572>: I had <WH935> your money <WH3701>. And he brought <WH3318> Simeon out unto them <WH8095>.

And the man <WH376> brought <WH935> the men <WH582> into Joseph <WH3130>'s house <WH1004>, and gave <WH5414> them water <WH4325>, and they washed <WH7364> their feet <WH7272>; and he gave <WH5414> their donkeys <WH2543> food <WH4554>.
And they made ready <WH3559> the present <WH4503> against <WH5704> Joseph <WH3130> coming <WH935> at noon <WH6672>: for they heard <WH8085> that they should eat <WH398> bread there <WH3899>.

And when Joseph <WH3130> came <WH935> home <WH1004>, they brought <WH935> him the present <WH4503> which was in their hand <WH3027> into the house <WH1004>, and bowed <WH7812> themselves to him to the earth <WH776>.
And he asked <WH7592> them of their welfare <WH7965>, and said <WH559>, Is your father <WH1> well <WH7965>, the old man <WH2205> of whom you spoke <WH559>? Is he yet alive <WH2416>?
And they answered <WH559>, your servant <WH5650> our father <WH1> is in good health <WH7965>, he is yet alive <WH2416>. And they bowed down their heads <WH6915>, and were humble <WH7812>.

And he lifted up <WH5375> his eyes <WH5869>, and saw <WH7200> his brother <WH251> Benjamin <WH1144>, his mother <WH517>'s son <WH1121>, and said <WH559>, Is this your younger <WH6996> brother <WH251>, of whom you spoke <WH559> unto me <WH559>? And he said, God <WH430> be gracious <WH2603> unto you my son <WH1121>.

And Joseph <WH3130> made haste <WH4116>; for his heart <WH7356> did yearn <WH3648> upon his brother <WH251>: and he sought <WH1245> where to weep <WH1058>; and he entered <WH935> into his chamber <WH2315>, and wept there <WH1058>.
And he washed <WH7364> his face <WH6440>, and went out <WH3318>, and refrained <WH662> himself <WH559>, and said, Set on <WH7760> bread <WH3899>.

And they set on <WH7760> for him by himself <WH4713>, and for them by themselves, and for the Egyptians, which did eat <WH398> with him <WH4713>, by themselves: because the Egyptians might <WH3201> not eat <WH398> bread <WH3899> with the Hebrews <WH5680>; for that is an abomination <WH8441> unto the Egyptians <WH4714>.

And they sat <WH3427> before him <WH6440>, the firstborn <WH1060> according to his birthright <WH1062>, and the youngest <WH6810> according to his youth <WH6812>: and the men <WH582> marveled <WH8539> one <WH376> at another <WH7453>.

And he took <WH5375> and sent portions <WH4864> unto them from before him <WH6440>: but Benjamin <WH1144>'s portion <WH4864> was five <WH2568> times <WH3027> so much as <WH7235> any of theirs <WH8354>. And they drank, and were merry with him <WH7937>.
